etymologies: late Middle English (in sense ‘instrument for measuring altitude or distance’): from Latin quadratum quadrate

definitions: each of a number of small areas of habitat, typically of one square meter, selected at random to act as samples for assessing the local distribution of plants or animals.
shortDefinitions: small area of habitat for assessing distribution of plants or animals

definitions: a portable frame, typically with an internal grid, used to mark out a quadrat.
shortDefinitions: portable frame used to mark out quadrat

definitions: (in letterpress printing) a small block of metal, lower than the face of the type, inserted to fill up short lines or adjust spacing.
shortDefinitions: small block of metal inserted to adjust spacing
